title: What are the UK's top 5 universities excluding Oxbridge? - Quora
tags: University Rankings in the United Kingdom
Colleges and Universities in the United Kingdom

response.answer_text: The Top 7 in the UK according to QS 2016 are :  3rd best in world. Cambridge 6th. Oxford 7th. University College London 8th. Imperial College London 19th. King's College London 21st. University of Edinburgh 35th. London School of Economics Top 7 UK according to Times Higher Education world ranking are : 2nd. Oxford 4th. Cambridge 8th. Imperial 14th. UCL 23rd. The LSE 24th. University of Edinburgh 27th. King's College London 56th. University of Manchester Best UK universities for individual subjects according to QS 2016: Art & Design :1st. Royal Holloway, University of London =51-100. University of Sussex =51-100. Birkbeck College, University of London

To answer this, you should really look at the UK rankings since they have a much richer dataset than the international rankings. The other five universities that feature in the top ten of all three national rankings are: St AndrewsImperialDurhamLoughboroughLancasterYou won't find all of these near the top of the international rankings, primarily due to the international rankings using reputation surveys (i.e. fame) to make up for their lack of hard facts. If you merge in the international rankings to get a composite list, you would replace Loughborough and Lancaster with LSE and UCL. This would probably have a better fit to most British people's idea of the prestige of the universities.
